issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

fields.summary: euca-describe-nodes does not return output in certain distributed topologies

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

fields.description:
When running euca-describe-nodes on the CLC, the following is observed:

{code}
[hspencer@odc-d-06-07 ~]$ euca-describe-nodes
[hspencer@odc-d-06-07 ~]$
{code}

There is one instance running:

{code}
[hspencer@odc-d-06-07 ~]$ euca-describe-instances
RESERVATION	r-2EA93F21	441445882805	default
INSTANCE	i-E0D0420B	emi-06663A57	10.104.7.10	172.17.116.169	running	euca-admin	0		m1.medium	2013-07-21T20:30:29.329Z	LayinDaSmackDown	eki-28F338EB	eri-51253C0A		monitoring-disabled	10.104.7.10	172.17.116.169			instance-store
TAG	instance	i-E0D0420B	euca:node	node1
{code}

If the same command on the CC machine, the following is returned:

{code}
[root@odc-d-06-08 ~]# euca-describe-nodes
could not connect to server: Connection refused
	Is the server running on host "localhost" and accepting
	TCP/IP connections on port 8777?
could not connect to server: Connection refused
	Is the server running on host "localhost" and accepting
	TCP/IP connections on port 8777?
{code}
fields.summary: euca-describe-nodes does not return output in certain distributed topologies
fields.environment:
*non-HA*

* 1 x CLC/Walrus
* 1 x CC/SC
* 1 x NC

~]# euca-describe-nodes --debug 2013-07-21 14:04:24,331 DescribeServices [DEBUG]:request_params: {'ShowEvents': 'false', 'ListUserServices': 'false', 'ListInternal': 'false', 'ByServiceType': 'node', 'ShowEventStacks': 'false', 'ListAll': 'true'} 2013-07-21 14:04:24,346 DescribeServices [DEBUG]:request_params: {'account': 'eucalyptus', 'zipfile': 'notused', 'euca_home': '/', 'user': 'admin'} could not connect to server: Connection refused Is the server running on host "localhost" and accepting TCP/IP connections on port 8777? could not connect to server: Connection refused Is the server running on host "localhost" and accepting TCP/IP connections on port 8777? {code} Looks like euca2ools isn't returning the information correctly. Version of euca2ools: {code} [hspencer@odc-d-06-07 ~]$ euca-version euca2ools 3.0.0 (Sparta) eucalyptus 3.3.0 {code}

Looks like the issue is here in _eucadmin/describenodes.py_:

{code}
obj = DescribeServices(debug=self.args.get('debug'))
 services = obj.main(all=True, filter_type='node', **args)
 service_statuses = services['euca:DescribeServicesResponseType'] \
     ['euca:serviceStatuses']
 nodes = {}
 for service in service_statuses:
     sid = service['euca:serviceId']
     hostname = sid.get('euca:hostName')
     nodes[sid['euca:name']] = {'partition': sid['euca:partition'],
                                'name': sid['euca:name'],
                                'hostname': hostname,
                                'state': service['euca:localState'],
                                'details': service['euca:details'],
                                'instances': {}}
{code}

After using pdb, _service_statuses_ is empty:

{code}
[hspencer@odc-d-06-07 ~]$ euca-describe-nodes --debug
2013-07-21 14:58:52,277 DescribeServices [DEBUG]:request_params: {'ShowEvents': 'false', 'ListUserServices': 'false', 'ListInternal': 'false', 'ByServiceType': 'node', 'ShowEventStacks': 'false', 'ListAll': 'true'}

It also looks like the following _if_ statement fails
{code}
if tag['key'] == 'euca:node' and tag['value'] in nodes:
{code}
therefore _nodes_ never get populated:

{code}
> /usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucadmin/describenodes.py(58)main()
-> for instance in reservation.get('instancesSet', []):
(Pdb) n
> /usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucadmin/describenodes.py(59)main()
-> i_info = {}
(Pdb) p nodes
{}
(Pdb) n
> /usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucadmin/describenodes.py(60)main()
-> for tag in instance.get('tagSet', []):
(Pdb) n
> /usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucadmin/describenodes.py(61)main()
-> if tag['key'] == 'euca:node' and tag['value'] in nodes:
(Pdb) p nodes
{}
(Pdb) p instance.get('tagSet', [])
[{u'value': u'node1', u'key': u'euca:node'}]
(Pdb) n
> /usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucadmin/describenodes.py(64)main()
-> elif tag['key'] == 'euca:node:migration:destination':
(Pdb) n
> /usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucadmin/describenodes.py(60)main()
-> for tag in instance.get('tagSet', []):
(Pdb) n
> /usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucadmin/describenodes.py(58)main()
-> for instance in reservation.get('instancesSet', []):
(Pdb) n
> /usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucadmin/describenodes.py(57)main()
-> for reservation in reservations:
(Pdb) n
> /usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucadmin/describenodes.py(67)main()
-> return nodes
(Pdb) p nodes

{code}
Reopening issue to make sure it has "Unconfirmed" state.

[~hspencer]

Do you have a reproducible test case for this? If not we will need to kick it out of 3.4 until we have one.

{{service_statuses}} is empty because the cloud controller reported no node controllers:

{code:xml}
<euca:DescribeServicesResponseType xmlns:euca="http://msgs.eucalyptus.com/3.3.0">
    <euca:EmpyreanMessage>
        <euca:_return>true</euca:_return>
        <euca:_services />
        <euca:_disabledServices />
        <euca:_notreadyServices />
    </euca:EmpyreanMessage>
    <euca:serviceStatuses />
</euca:DescribeServicesResponseType>
{code}

This therefore appears to be a server-side issue.

*Steps to Reproduce*

* Follow instructions regarding installing Eucalyptus 3.3.1 from packages on 3 machines.  The components will be split up as follows:
** 1 x CLC, Walrus
{code}
# ip addr show
1: lo: <LOOPBACK,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 16436 qdisc noqueue state UNKNOWN
    link/loopback 00:00:00:00:00:00 brd 00:00:00:00:00:00
    inet 127.0.0.1/8 scope host lo
    inet6 ::1/128 scope host
       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever
2: em1: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 1500 qdisc mq state UP qlen 1000
    link/ether e8:9a:8f:bd:c4:46 brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff
    inet 10.104.1.216/16 brd 10.104.255.255 scope global em1
    inet6 fe80::ea9a:8fff:febd:c446/64 scope link
       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever
3: em2: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 1500 qdisc mq state UP qlen 1000
    link/ether e8:9a:8f:bd:c4:47 brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff
    inet 10.105.1.216/16 brd 10.105.255.255 scope global em2
    inet6 fe80::ea9a:8fff:febd:c447/64 scope link
       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever
{code}
** 1 x CC, SC
{code}
# ip addr show
1: lo: <LOOPBACK,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 16436 qdisc noqueue state UNKNOWN
    link/loopback 00:00:00:00:00:00 brd 00:00:00:00:00:00
    inet 127.0.0.1/8 scope host lo
    inet6 ::1/128 scope host
       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever
2: em1: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 1500 qdisc mq state UP qlen 1000
    link/ether e8:9a:8f:bd:c3:46 brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff
    inet 10.104.1.217/16 brd 10.104.255.255 scope global em1
    inet6 fe80::ea9a:8fff:febd:c346/64 scope link
       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever
3: em2: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 1500 qdisc mq state UP qlen 1000
    link/ether e8:9a:8f:bd:c3:47 brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff
    inet 169.254.169.254/32 scope link em2
    inet 10.105.1.217/16 brd 10.105.255.255 scope global em2
    inet6 fe80::ea9a:8fff:febd:c347/64 scope link
       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever
{code}
** 1 x NC
{code}
# ip addr show
1: lo: <LOOPBACK,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 16436 qdisc noqueue state UNKNOWN
    link/loopback 00:00:00:00:00:00 brd 00:00:00:00:00:00
    inet 127.0.0.1/8 scope host lo
    inet6 ::1/128 scope host
       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever
2: em1: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST> mtu 1500 qdisc noop state DOWN qlen 1000
    link/ether e8:9a:8f:bd:c4:44 brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff
3: em2: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 1500 qdisc mq state UP qlen 1000
    link/ether e8:9a:8f:bd:c4:45 brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff
    inet 10.105.1.218/16 brd 10.105.255.255 scope global em2
    inet6 fe80::ea9a:8fff:febd:c445/64 scope link
       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever
4: virbr0: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 1500 qdisc noqueue state UNKNOWN
    link/ether 52:54:00:c2:e6:53 brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff
    inet 192.168.122.1/24 brd 192.168.122.255 scope global virbr0
5: virbr0-nic: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST> mtu 1500 qdisc noop state DOWN qlen 500
    link/ether 52:54:00:c2:e6:53 brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff
{code}
* Configure CLC, Walrus machine with the a eucalyptus.conf file similar to the following:
{code}
CC_PORT="8774"
CLOUD_OPTS="-Xmx4g"
EUCALYPTUS="/"
EUCA_USER="eucalyptus"
HYPERVISOR="kvm"
INSTANCE_PATH="/var/lib/eucalyptus/instances"
NC_PORT="8775"
NC_SERVICE="axis2/services/EucalyptusNC"
NODES=""
SCHEDPOLICY="ROUNDROBIN"
USE_VIRTIO_DISK="1"
USE_VIRTIO_NET="1"
USE_VIRTIO_ROOT="1"
VNET_ADDRSPERNET="32"
VNET_DHCPDAEMON="/usr/sbin/dhcpd41"
VNET_DNS="10.1.1.254"
VNET_MODE="MANAGED"
VNET_NETMASK="255.255.0.0"
VNET_PUBINTERFACE="em1"
VNET_PUBLICIPS="10.104.7.10-10.104.7.20"
VNET_SUBNET="172.17.0.0"
{code}
* Configure the CC, SC machine with a eucalyptus.conf that looks similar to the following:
{code}
CC_PORT="8774"
CLOUD_OPTS=""
EUCALYPTUS="/"
EUCA_USER="eucalyptus"
HYPERVISOR="kvm"
INSTANCE_PATH="/var/lib/eucalyptus/instances"
LOGLEVEL="DEBUG"
NC_PORT="8775"
NC_SERVICE="axis2/services/EucalyptusNC"
NODES="node1"
SCHEDPOLICY="ROUNDROBIN"
USE_VIRTIO_DISK="1"
USE_VIRTIO_NET="1"
USE_VIRTIO_ROOT="1"
VNET_ADDRSPERNET="32"
VNET_DHCPDAEMON="/usr/sbin/dhcpd41"
VNET_DNS="10.1.1.254"
VNET_MODE="MANAGED"
VNET_NETMASK="255.255.0.0"
VNET_PRIVINTERFACE="em2"
VNET_PUBINTERFACE="em1"
VNET_PUBLICIPS="10.104.7.10-10.104.7.20"
VNET_SUBNET="172.17.0.0"
{code}
* Set up forwarding on the CC in the sysctl.conf file and MASQ rules in iptables, which then need to be stored in /etc/eucalyptus/iptables-preload:
{code}
]# sysctl -p /etc/sysctl.conf
net.ipv4.ip_forward = 1
net.ipv4.conf.default.rp_filter = 1
net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_source_route = 0
kernel.sysrq = 0
kernel.core_uses_pid = 1
net.ipv4.tcp_syncookies = 1
kernel.msgmnb = 65536
kernel.msgmax = 65536
kernel.shmmax = 68719476736
kernel.shmall = 4294967296
# cat /etc/eucalyptus/iptables-preload
# Generated by iptables-save v1.4.7 on Thu Jun 27 16:54:12 2013
*filter
:INPUT ACCEPT [292:21400]
:FORWARD ACCEPT [0:0]
:OUTPUT ACCEPT [140:14552]
-A FORWARD -i em2 -o em1 -m state --state RELATED,ESTABLISHED -j ACCEPT
-A FORWARD -i em2 -o em1 -j ACCEPT
COMMIT
# Completed on Thu Jun 27 16:54:12 2013
# Generated by iptables-save v1.4.7 on Thu Jun 27 16:54:12 2013
*nat
:PREROUTING ACCEPT [2:360]
:POSTROUTING ACCEPT [0:0]
:OUTPUT ACCEPT [1:164]
-A POSTROUTING -o em1 -j MASQUERADE
COMMIT
# Completed on Thu Jun 27 16:54:12 2013
{code}
* Set the NC to use the private interface of the CC as the gateway.  Interface configuration should look something similar to this:
{code}
# cat /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ifcfg-em2
DEVICE=em2
ONBOOT=yes
HWADDR=e8:9a:8f:bd:c4:45
TYPE=Ethernet
BOOTPROTO=none
IPADDR=10.105.1.218
NETMASK=255.255.0.0
DNS1=10.1.1.254
DNS2=8.8.8.8
GATEWAY=10.105.1.217
IPV6INIT=no
USERCTL=no
{code}
* Start CLC, Walrus
{code}
# service eucalyptus-cloud start
{code}
* Start CC, SC
{code}
# service eucalyptus-cloud start
# service eucalyptus-cc cleanstart
{code}
* Start NC
{code}
# service eucalyptus-nc start
{code}
* Initialize and register components from the CLC
{code}
# /usr/sbin/euca_conf --initialize
# /usr/sbin/euca_conf --register-walrus --partition walrus --host 10.104.1.216 --component Back2DaHood
# /usr/sbin/euca_conf --register-cluster --partition LayinDaSmackDown --host 10.104.1.217 --component GhettyGreen
# /usr/sbin/euca_conf --register-sc --partition LayinDaSmackDown --host 10.104.1.217 --component WalkinBankRoll
{code}
* Register NC from CC
{code}
# cat /etc/hosts
127.0.0.1   localhost localhost.localdomain localhost4 localhost4.localdomain4
::1         localhost localhost.localdomain localhost6 localhost6.localdomain6

10.105.1.218 node1
# /usr/sbin/euca_conf --register-nodes node1
{code}
* Observe services are all up and running and enabled:

$ mv admin.zip admin-creds/.
$ sudo chown hspencer:hspencer admin.zip
$ unzip admin.zip
$ source admin-creds/eucarc
$ euca-describe-services

* Run euca-describe-nodes and notice no output:
{code}
$ euca-describe-nodes

[~viglesias], this cloud is currently up now. Access it at anytime.  Please let me know if there are any questions.

Dropped the _Priority_ and _Benefit_ since there is a valid workaround.

*Workaround*

As user of the _eucalyptus_ account, the cloud admin can view which instances are running on which nodes by using {code}euca-describe-instances verbose{code} and seeing the value after _euca:node_:

{code}
$ euca-describe-instances verbose
RESERVATION	r-960C41FD	441445882805	default
INSTANCE	i-CB38439D	emi-06663A57	euca-10-104-7-10.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-172-17-118-214.eucalyptus.internal	running	euca-admin	0		m1.medium	2013-09-24T13:56:24.886Z	LayinDaSmackDown	eki-28F338EB	eri-51253C0A		monitoring-disabled	10.104.7.10	172.17.118.214			instance-store
TAG	instance	i-CB38439D	euca:node	node1
{code}

No longer seeing this behavior on 4.1.0 with the same topology:
